meaningMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>yield</kanji>, and 屈む means <vocabulary>to bend down</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to crouch</vocabulary>. After all, bending down and crouching are sort of like yielding to gravity, don’t you think?

屈む refers to the act of lowering your head or body, so it can also mean <vocabulary>to duck</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to squat</vocabulary> depending on the context.
